p:
The results on Figure 6(B) reveal that the aqueous extracts from Plectranthus spp. plants were not effective as elastase inhibitors ( p > 0.05), being the P. grandidentatus aqueous extract the only one able to inhibit the elastase enzyme, by 23.8 10.0% ( p < 0.0001). This result can be attributed to different and decreased synergy of the polyphenols present in P. grandidentatus aqueous extract, in comparison with the remaining aqueous extracts
34 . Nevertheless, the isolated compounds from both organic and aqueous extracts were further assessed for their ability to inhibit elastase activity ( Figure 6(C)).
